introduction:
Weight loss is not about starvation; it's about nourishment and metabolic balance.

If you have tried every diet under the sun—Keto, GM, intermittent fasting—and gained the weight back, it's because you treated the symptom (fat), not the cause (metabolism). At Delhi Wellness Haven, we understand that obesity is a complex interplay of hormones, gut health, and psychology.

Our Sustainable Weight Loss Program is designed to reset your metabolic set-point. We don't just help you lose kilos; we help you gain energy, confidence, and health. We use Udwarthanam (dry powder massage), steam therapies, and a scientific nutrition plan to turn your body into a fat-burning machine.

sections.title: Why Diets Fail: The Metabolic Adaptation
sections.content:
When you starve yourself, your body thinks there is a famine. It slows down your metabolism to save energy. Once you eat normally again, you gain weight faster than before. This is the Yo-Yo effect.

Our Approach is Different:

  • We feed your muscles (which burn fat) and starve your fat cells (via insulin control).
  • We correct hormonal blocks like Hypothyroidism and PCOD that make weight loss impossible.
  • We address emotional eating triggers.

sections.title: Therapies for Fat Loss
sections.content:
1. Udwarthanam (Dry Powder Massage)

A vigorous massage using herbal powders that creates friction and heat. It liquefies subcutaneous fat, improves lymphatic drainage, and reduces cellulite. It is one of the most effective therapies for inch loss.

2. Steam Bath & Sauna

Passive sweating increases heart rate and metabolic rate. It helps in detoxifying the fat cells, as toxins are often stored in adipose tissue.

3. Enema & Colon Cleansing

A clogged colon leads to poor nutrient absorption and lethargy. Cleansing the colon often leads to an immediate drop in bloating and water weight, giving a kickstart to the journey.

4. Yoga for Core Strength

We focus on dynamic yoga (Power Yoga / Surya Namaskar) to build lean muscle mass. Muscle tissue burns more calories at rest than fat tissue.

faq.question: How much weight can I expect to lose?
faq.answer: A healthy, sustainable rate is 3-5 kgs per month. Losing faster than this often means muscle loss, which damages metabolism long-term.

faq.question: Do you give diet pills?
faq.answer: Absolutely not. We rely on natural herbs (like Triphala, Guggul) and food as medicine.
